

update the hero and about me section with updated the figma designs 



fire mini animation code in pure html3

fire mini animation code in pure html3


<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Grounded 6-Frame Cartoon Fire</title>
    <style>
        body {
            display: flex;
            justify-content: center;
            align-items: center;
            min-height: 100vh;
            background-color: #050505;
            margin: 0;
            overflow: hidden;
        }

        .flame-container {
            width: 350px;
            height: 450px;
            display: flex;
            justify-content: center;
            align-items: flex-end; 
            padding-bottom: 20px;
        }

        svg {
            width: 100%;
            height: 100%;
        }

        /* Standard 2-Layer Cartoon Styling */
        #outer-path {
            fill: #F50000;
            stroke: black;
            stroke-width: 0.8px;
        }

        #inner-path {
            fill: #FE9D32;
            stroke: black;
            stroke-width: 0.6px;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>

    <div class="flame-container">

            <path id="outer-path" d="" />
            <path id="inner-path" d="" />
        </svg>
    </div>

            }
        ];

        const outerPath = document.getElementById('outer-path');
        const innerPath = document.getElementById('inner-path');
        let currentIdx = 0;

        // Set Frame 0
        outerPath.setAttribute('d', fireData[0].outer);
        innerPath.setAttribute('d', fireData[0].inner);

        function animateFire() {
            let nextIdx;
            do {
                nextIdx = Math.floor(Math.random() * fireData.length);
            } while (nextIdx === currentIdx);

            const nextData = fireData[nextIdx];
            const tl = gsap.timeline({ onComplete: animateFire });
            
            tl.to([outerPath, innerPath], {
                opacity: 0.75, // Rapid flicker start
                duration: 0.05,
                ease: "none"
            })
            .call(() => {
                // SEQUENTIAL UPDATE:
                // Step 1: Change Inner layer
                innerPath.setAttribute('d', nextData.inner);
            })
            .delay(0.04) // Tiny professional "lag" between layers
            .call(() => {
                // Step 2: Change Outer layer
                outerPath.setAttribute('d', nextData.outer);
            })
            .to([outerPath, innerPath], {
                opacity: 1, // Rapid flicker end
                duration: 0.05,
                ease: "none"
            })
            .delay(0.05 + Math.random() * 0.05);

            currentIdx = nextIdx;
        }

        animateFire();
    </script>
</body>
</html>
